poem:
**Mending the Air Between Us**

The wall leans a little,  
casting long shadows on the yard,  
and our chatter rises over it,  
a volley of sparrows.  
Laughter slips through the cracks—  
no border can hold it back—  
and here we are,  
neighbors in the truest sense,  
sharing the sky,  
not the fence.
